slideInfo.qText: Write a short paragraph comparing and contrasting the point of view of King James I and members of the House of Commons in 1604.
slideInfo.correctText:
Paragraphs should note the following:
James was a king so his point of view was that of a monarch.
James was biased towards the divine right of kings because he was a king.
The members of the House of Commons were elected officials so their point of view establishes the importance of the House of Commons to running the nation.
The members of the House of Commons were biased towards a limited monarchy that respected the powers and views of Parliament because they were elected officials.
King James I and the members of the House of Commons have different points of view.
